ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:0.5_0: 53. The training rule on licking the almsbowl
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their bowls while eating. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lick my almsbowl while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.4_0: he should not eat licking his bowl;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his bowl while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.11_0: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then licking it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.15_0: The third rule, the third training rule on fire, is finished.
